parameter.name: X
parameter.comment: The way to measure dependencies. default: lbf (frequencies only) | TODO: No label dependence still missing as an option

parameter.name: Is
parameter.comment: The number of iterations to search the chain space at train time. default: 0

parameter.name: Iy
parameter.comment: The number of iterations to search the output space at test time. default: 10

parameter.name: P
parameter.comment: Sets the payoff function. Any of those listed in regular evaluation output will do (e.g., 'Exact match'). default: Exact match

parameter.name: M
parameter.comment: The population size (of chains) __ should be smaller than the total number of chains evaluated (Is) default: 10

parameter.name: O
parameter.comment: Use temperature: cool the chain down over time (from the beginning of the chain) __ can be faster default: 0 (no temperature)

parameter.name: B
parameter.comment: If using O = 1 for temperature, this sets the Beta constant default: 0.03

parameter.name: Is
parameter.comment: The number of iterations to search the chain space at train time. default: 0

parameter.name: Iy
parameter.comment: The number of iterations to search the output space at test time. default: 10

parameter.name: P
parameter.comment: Sets the payoff function. Any of those listed in regular evaluation output will do (e.g., 'Exact match'). default: Exact match

parameter.name: H
parameter.comment: Determines the width of the trellis (use 0 for chain; use _1 for a square trellis, i.e., width of sqrt(number of labels)).

parameter.name: X
parameter.comment: The way to measure dependencies. default: lbf (frequencies only) | TODO: No label dependence still missing as an option
Determines the neighbourhood density (the number of neighbours for each node in the trellis). CAUTION: default obtained from source code. No idea about good other values

parameter.name: I
parameter.comment: The total number of iterations. default: 1000

parameter.name: Ic
parameter.comment: The number of collection iterations. default: 100

parameter.name: H
parameter.comment: Determines the width of the trellis (use 0 for chain; use _1 for a square trellis, i.e., width of sqrt(number of labels)).

parameter.name: L
parameter.comment: Determines the neighbourhood density (the number of neighbours for each node in the trellis). CAUTION: default obtained from source code. No idea about good other values
The dependency heuristic to use in rearranging the trellis (None by default).
parameter.name: X
I
parameter.comment: The total number of iterations. default: 1000

parameter.name: Ic
parameter.comment: The number of collection iterations. default: 100

parameter.name: P
parameter.comment: Sets the pruning value, defining an infrequent labelset as one which occurs <= P times in the data (P = 0 defaults to LC). default: 0 (LC)

parameter.name: N
parameter.comment: Sets the (maximum) number of frequent labelsets to subsample from the infrequent labelsets. default: 0 (none) n N = n _n N = n, or 0 if LCard(D) >= 2 n_m N = random(n,m).

components.name: meka.classifiers.multilabel.RAkEL
components.comment:
LEFT OUT: _k  The number of labels in each partition __ should be 1 <= k < (L/2) where L is the total number of labels
LEFT OUT: _N  Sets the (maximum) number of frequent labelsets to subsample from the infrequent labelsets. default: 0 (none) n N = n _n N = n, or 0 if LCard(D) >= 2 n_m N = random(n,m).

parameter.name: M
parameter.comment: Sets M (default 10): the number of subsets

parameter.name: P
parameter.comment: Sets the pruning value, defining an infrequent labelset as one which occurs <= P times in the data (P = 0 defaults to LC). default: 0 (LC)

parameter.name: N
parameter.comment: Sets the (maximum) number of frequent labelsets to subsample from the infrequent labelsets. default: 0 (none) n N = n _n N = n, or 0 if LCard(D) >= 2 n_m N = random(n,m)

LEFT OUT: _N  Sets the (maximum) number of frequent labelsets to subsample from the infrequent labelsets. default: 0 (none) n N = n _n N = n, or 0 if LCard(D) >= 2 n_m N = random(n,m).

parameter.comment: Sets the pruning value, defining an infrequent labelset as one which occurs <= P times in the data (P = 0 defaults to LC). default: 0 (LC)

parameter.name: N
parameter.comment: Sets the (maximum) number of frequent labelsets to subsample from the infrequent labelsets. default: 0 (none) n N = n _n N = n, or 0 if LCard(D) >= 2 n_m N = random(n,m)

parameter.name: H
parameter.comment: Sets the number of hidden units default: 10

parameter.name: E
parameter.comment: Sets the maximum number of epochs default: 1000 (auto_cut_out)

parameter.name: r
parameter.comment: Sets the learning rate (tyically somewhere between 'very small' and 0.1) default: 0.1

parameter.name: m
parameter.comment: Sets the momentum (typically somewhere between 0.1 and 0.9) default: 0.1
